userreviews.userReview: OMG! These just keep getting better...I just adore the growing rapport between Dave and Howie. The new guys are just phenomenal too! Blowers, Cookey and Tucker and his blasted spatula...I cannot wait to see what lays in store for this mis-matched band of miscreants...I just love these books!Some of my favorite insights/quotes:-Dave = Picky Bugger"super brown trousers" "With all due respect, Sir...F** off!!"Final thought:That's it, I'm bringing a spatula to the Zombie Apocalypse! (Along with the obligatory tea and marmalade on toast, of course ;) )

still good, the third day after the outbreak, we have our friends directed to Salisbury to gain an armored vehicle in order to save the sister of Howie. Ours heroes are now fighting against men and zombies, equal in evilness. But in the end they will win and meet new friend. In the day four they arrive in Salisbury where they meet some young boys just survived the first wave and desperate for a guidance, they will follow Dave and Howie until they catch the vehicle and heading towards London to rescue Sarah.

I realised that the reviews I'm giving are for part 4 of the audiobook, which seems to be following a later timeline than the written edition. This review will be for part 4 of the audiobook in which Howie and the gang leave Fort Spitbank, and pursue the women and children from Fort Spitbank onto the Isle of Wight.Zombie Darren meets a girl zombie, Marcy, who can also talk. This part of the storyline is getting so stupid. His rants and tirades aren't well written; they're just sweary. The zombie "sex" was embarrassing, and utterly unnecessary. I will continue with this series, because Darren is now dead - shot by Dave - and I'm interested to see Marcy in charge but I think I'll have a little break before starting the next one. This was a bit daft.The bits which were cool were really cool (e.g. Clarence throwing canisters of gas over the horde, and Dave shooting them to make huge bombs) but the parts with Darren were ridiculous, and elements of it (e.g. the church defence) seemed really similar to earlier parts of the story.

Once more, the dynamic of Mister Howie and Dave is just a fun romp in the zombie apocalypse. I liked the new characters introduced on this day. My only complaints would be that I thought there was more recap than necessary at the start, and I'm not real fond of the nature of the infection. But I'm definitely still willing to tag along for the ride.
The stuff from the point if view of the infection is just weird. Generally this is a fun and easy read but the weakest so far in the series.

description: My name is Howie. I was named after my father Howard, but it became too confusing to have two Howards, so I became Howie. I am 27 years old and I work as a night’s manager in a supermarket.I will tell you what happened.On Friday the world fell apart. A zombie infestation has ravaged Europe. Howie was at home and quickly had to learn to fight and survive in this new world as he battled through hordes of undead, desperately trying to reach his family...The Undead Day One.On Saturday he went back to his town but an undead stripper and her psychotic boyfriend awaited him. Then he met Dave and everything changed as they went to war on the undead...The Undead Day Two.On Sunday, Howie and Dave have to travel across country still searching for Howies family. Their travels bring them into contact with many strange people as they battle with zombies and other survivors...The Undead Day Three.Monday. Day Four. Howie and Dave have to battle their way out of the police station and make a disturbing discovery. They finally reach Salisbury Army Training Centre and find a massive army of undead soldier zombies, new recruits, an arrogant and cowardly officer and more battles. Meanwhile the infection is learning to control new species…The Undead Day Four. 46,408 words.
